roleset.name: demand full attention

example.name: usually passive
example.text: Worst of all, Nissan-1 was preoccupied *trace*-1 with management infighting, cronyism and corporate rigidity.
example.arg: with management infighting, cronyism and corporate rigidity.

example.name: occasionally active
example.text: Foreign exchange dealers said that the currency market has begun to distance itself from the volatile stock exchange, which *trace* has preoccupied the market since Oct. 13, when the Dow Jones Industrial Average plunged more than 190 points.
example.arg: since Oct. 13, when the Dow Jones Industrial Average plunged more than 190 points.

example.name: Arg1,2
example.text: At last the Archbishop of Canterbury is moving out of his preoccupation with papalizing the Anglicans and being a voice for the poor.

roleset.note: PREOCCUPY-V NOTES: Frames file for 'preoccupy' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 31.1 (from preoccupy.01-v predicate notes)
To my ear, args 0 and 2 cannot cooccur, but the prepositional usage ofarg2 does imply that the two are separate arguments. (from preoccupy.01-v)
